required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Database Studies From Reproductive Endocrinology Practice Looking at Relationships Between Demographics, Stimulation Protocols and Outcomes, Retrieval and Transfer Outcomes, Number and Quality of Oocytes and Embryos Retrieved and Transferred, Pregnancy Rates and Pregnancy Outcomes.

lead_sponsor.agency: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: Data collection and comparison of relationships between patient demographics, stimulation protocols and outcomes, retrieval and transfer outcomes, number and quality of oocytes and embryos retrieved and transferred, pregnancy rates and pregnancy outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: No patient treatment is associated with the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Improving Rates while Decreasing Adverse Outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Retrospective database analysis in order to advance the field of reproductive endocrinology, to learn about reproductive aging and diminished ovarian reserve, to correlate oocyte and embryo quality with pregnancy rates and outcomes, and to reduce adverse outcomes such as Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome (OHSS) and multiple pregnancy rates.

study_pop.textblock: All patients undergoing infertility treatment in our practice.

overall_official.affiliation: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

facility.name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

link.description: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey
